unnormalised: Environmental Woes? Mumbai Gets a Waste Management Makeover!
normalised: Environmental Woes? Mumbai Gets a Waste Management Makeover!

unnormalised: Hey folks, are you tired of seeing garbage piling up higher than Amitabh Bachchan in "Deewar"? Well, there's good news on the waste management front! BMC (Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation) just announced a major overhaul of the city's waste disposal system.
normalised: Hey folks, are you tired of seeing garbage piling up higher than Amitabh Bachchan in "Deewar"? Well, there's good news on the waste management front! B M C (Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation) just announced a major overhaul of the city's waste disposal system.

unnormalised: The project, estimated at Rs. 500 crores, aims to reduce landfill waste by 60% within the next 3 years. This includes composting initiatives at the ward level and implementing stricter recycling protocols across residential societies, even at places like Juhu!
normalised: The project, estimated at rupee five hundred crores, aims to reduce landfill waste by sixty percent within the next three years. This includes composting initiatives at the ward level and implementing stricter recycling protocols across residential societies, even at places like Juhu!

unnormalised: IIT Bombay is partnering with the BMC to analyze waste composition and optimize collection routes. Imagine, no more overflowing bins near your favourite vada pav stall! They are also piloting a waste-to-energy plant near Deonar dumping ground, converting trash into electricity – pretty cool, right?
normalised: I I T Bombay is partnering with the B M C to analyze waste composition and optimize collection routes. Imagine, no more overflowing bins near your favourite vada pav stall! They are also piloting a waste-to-energy plant near Deonar dumping ground, converting trash into electricity – pretty cool, right?

unnormalised: Speaking of waste, a new awareness campaign, "Swachh Bharat, Swachh Mumbai," is launching soon to encourage households to segregate waste at the source. Let's all do our part to make Mumbai a cleaner, greener city, yaar! Every little bit helps, just like saving the world, one dialogue at a time.
normalised: Speaking of waste, a new awareness campaign, "Swachh Bharat, Swachh Mumbai," is launching soon to encourage households to segregate waste at the source. Let's all do our part to make Mumbai a cleaner, greener city, yaar! Every little bit helps, just like saving the world, one dialogue at a time.
